title: nf-core/mhcquant pipeline parameters
description: Identify and quantify peptides from mass spectrometry raw data

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Input raw / mzML files listed in a tsv file (see help for details)
input.help_text:
Use this to specify a sample sheet table including your input raw or mzml files as well as their meta information such as SampleID and Condition. For example:

| ID   | Sample      | Condition  |   ReplicateFileName                       |
| -----|:------------:| ----------:|------------------------------------------:|
| 1    | MM15_Melanom |      A     |   data/MM15_Melanom_W_1_A_standard.raw    |
| 2    | MM15_Melanom |      B     |   data/MM15_Melanom_W_1_B_standard.raw    |
| 3    | MM17_Melanom |      B     |   data/MM17_Melanom_W_1_B_standard.raw    |

```bash
--input 'path/samples.tsv'
```

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

fasta.help_text: Path to the protein database file

skip_decoy_generation.description: Add this parameter when you want to skip the generation of the decoy database.
skip_decoy_generation.help_text: If you want to use your own decoys, you can specify a dataset that includes decoy sequences. However, each database entry should keep the prefix 'DECOY_'.

run_centroidisation.description: Include the flag when the specified ms level is not centroided (default=false).

pick_ms_levels.description: Specify the MS levels for which the peak picking is applied (unless you use `--run_centroidisation`).

filter_mzml.description: Clean up spectrum files and remove artificial charge 0 peptides.

instrument.description: Comets theoretical_fragment_ions parameter: theoretical fragment ion peak representation, high_res: sum of intensities plus flanking bins, ion trap (low_res) ms/ms: sum of intensities of central M bin only

enzyme.description: Specify which enzymatic restriction should be applied
enzyme.help_text: For HLA peptides rarely other enzymes are used, however most enzymes such as for example 'Trypsin' are available.

activation_method.description: Specify which fragmentation method was used in the MS acquisition
activation_method.help_text: If not specified, `ALL` tries to infer the fragmentation method based on the spectrum file

digest_mass_range.description: Specify the mass range in Dalton that peptides should fulfill to be considered for peptide spectrum matching.

prec_charge.description: Specify the precursor charge range that peptides should fulfill to be considered for peptide spectrum matching.

precursor_mass_tolerance.description: Specify the precursor mass tolerance to be used for the Comet database search.
precursor_mass_tolerance.help_text: For high-resolution instruments a precursor mass tolerance value of 5ppm is recommended. (eg. 5)

precursor_error_units.description: Specify the unit of the precursor mass tolerance to be used for the Comet database search.

fragment_bin_offset.description: Specify the fragment bin offset to be used for the comet database search.
fragment_bin_offset.help_text:
For high-resolution instruments a fragment bin offset of 0 is recommended. (See the Comet parameter documentation: https://uwpr.github.io/Comet/parameters/parameters_202401/).
 This parameter needs to be combined with `fragment_bin_tol` parameter

fragment_mass_tolerance.description: Specify the fragment mass tolerance to be used for the comet database search.
fragment_mass_tolerance.help_text:
For high-resolution instruments a fragment mass tolerance value of 0.02 is recommended
(See the Comet parameter documentation: https://uwpr.github.io/Comet/parameters/parameters_202401/).
The OpenCometAdapter mulitplies this parameter with 2 to align with other search engines.

number_mods.description: Specify the maximum number of modifications that should be contained in a peptide sequence match.

fixed_mods.description: Specify which fixed modifications should be applied to the database search
fixed_mods.help_text:
e.g. 'Carbamidomethyl (C)' (see OpenMS modifications; for a list of options, see parameter description on https://abibuilder.informatik.uni-tuebingen.de/archive/openms/Documentation/nightly/html/TOPP_CometAdapter.html).
Multiple modifications can be specified by separating commas:`Oxidation (M),Carbamidomethyl (C)`

variable_mods.description: Specify which variable modifications should be applied to the database search
variable_mods.help_text:
e.g. 'Oxidation (M)' (see OpenMS modifications; for a list of options, see parameter description on https://abibuilder.informatik.uni-tuebingen.de/archive/openms/Documentation/nightly/html/TOPP_CometAdapter.html).
Multiple modifications can be specified by separating commas:`Oxidation (M),Carbamidomethyl (C)`

num_hits.description: Specify the number of hits that should be reported for each spectrum.

use_x_ions.description: Include x ions into the peptide spectrum matching

use_z_ions.description: Include z ions into the peptide spectrum matching

use_a_ions.description: Include a ions into the peptide spectrum matching

use_c_ions.description: Include c ions into the peptide spectrum matching

use_NL_ions.description: Include NL ions into the peptide spectrum matching

remove_precursor_peak.description: Include if you want to remove all peaks around precursor m/z

spectrum_batch_size.description: Size of Spectrum batch for Comet processing (Decrease/Increase depending on Memory Availability)

default_params_file_comet.description: Specify custom Comet params file. All parameters of this take precedence.

rescoring_engine.description: Specify the rescoring engine that should be used for rescoring. Either percolator or mokapot

feature_generators.description: Specify the feature generator that should be used for rescoring. One or multiple of basic,ms2pip,deeplc,ionmob

ms2pip_model.description: Specify the MS²PIP model that should be used for rescoring. Checkout the MS²PIP documentation for available models.

ms2pip_model_dir.description: Specify a local directory holding at least the MS²PIP models specified in `ms2pip_model`.

deeplc_calibration_set_size.description: Specify the number or percentage of PSMs that should be used for calibration of the DeepLC model.

fdr_level.description: Specify the level at which the false discovery rate should be computed.

fdr_threshold.description: Specify the false discovery rate threshold at which peptide hits should be selected.

subset_max_train.description: Maximum subset for Percolator training iterations

max_rt_alignment_shift.description: Set a maximum retention time shift for the linear RT alignment

quantification_fdr.description: Compute FDR for the targeted approach
quantification_fdr.help_text: (Weisser H. and Choudhary J.S. J Proteome Res. 2017 Aug 4)

quantification_min_prob.description: Specify a cut off probability value for quantification events as a filter

quantification_mz_window.description: Specify a m/z window for matching between runs

quantification_rt_window.description: Specify a rt window for matching between runs

quantification_mapping_tolerance.description: Specify a rt mapping tolerance for mapping features between runs

quantification_peak_width.description: Specify a peak width for feature extraction

quantification_min_peak_width.description: Specify a minimum peak width for quantification

peptide_min_length.description: Specify the minimum length of peptides to be considered after processing

peptide_max_length.description: Specify the maximum length of peptides to be considered after processing

annotate_ions.description: Create tsv files containing information about the MS2 ion annotations after processing.
annotate_ions.help_text: The resulting tsv files should aid in spectrum validation downstream analyses

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files
